channel.title: projects on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in projects on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: Hieroglyph 0.3.2: Slide Table and Interlinking
item.description: Since PyCon I’ve continued to think about how I can make slides from ReStructured Text documents and vice versa.

item.title: hieroglyph: Easy, Beautiful Slides with Restructured Text
item.description: I was happy to have my talk proposal accepted for PyCon this year, and happy with the feedback I received on my talk (Django Forms Deep Dive ).

item.title: Food Blogging: The Dutch Delight
item.description: Since moving to our new neighborhood, I’ve been cooking a lot more, particularly from the church cookbook I grew up with (see also, my post on Sugar Crème Küchen ).

item.title: RDFa Bookmarklets for Ubiquity
item.description: I’ve been aware of Ubiquity since it launched and have meant to dig in and play with it for a while.

item.title: Readonly Attachments for Thunderbird 2
item.description: Last seen here two years ago , I’ve just updated Readonly Attachments for Thunderbird 2 .

item.title: ccPublisher 2, Beta 1 is out the door
item.description: It’s late, it’s delayed, and it doesn’t do everything I wanted it to.

item.title: Packaging Applications for Linux with Autopackage
item.description: One of the most frequent [STRIKEOUT:complaints]requests I receive for ccPublisher and ccLookup is for Linux packages.

item.title: wpLicense: Works For You?
item.description: So last month I announced the release of wpLicense 0.

item.title: Get Your CC Fix Here
item.description: For all you Mac OS X users who can’t get enough Creative Commons licensed content, your fix has arrived: a CC search plugin for Sherlock .

item.title: Verifying Creative Commons Licenses
item.description: We’ve had command line implementations for quite some time, but today I released our new graphical lookup tool, imaginatively named ccLookup.

item.title: ccTag updated
item.description: I’ve updated ccTag , the graphical interface for tagging audio files with Creative Commons licenses.
